My first online game (still ongoing by the way) I still have people calling me “he” and I’ve given up correcting them 😂 I suppose it’s not that big a deal. But very cool to have some company this game.

England I don’t have a solid read off, but he’s basically just nudged me to see how I am and that’s as far as we’ve gone. Russia seems to have big plans, but I have no reason to believe he hasn’t made the same overtures elsewhere, you know? Still, he seems more concrete.

messages.message:
It’s the funniest thing, o Queen in the North. I’ve been chatting with folk (not a great deal else to do as Italy at this point) and one common theme keeps coming up; Russia offering them an alliance. He’s offered one to me. He’s offered one to Turkey, and to Austria. He’s offered one to England, and I presume he’s offered one to you. If I had to play the odds I’d guess he’s offered one to France as well, but the President and I aren’t really on those friendly terms. 

Can you confirm your part of this, and what he’s trying to persuade you to in an alliance? And if so, what should we do about this? It can be useful having a completely unscrupulous archtraitor around, if we know who that is and don’t let them get so powerful that their opportunism backfired on us.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'It’s the funniest thing, o Queen in the North. I’ve been chatting with folk (not a great deal else to do as Italy at this point) and one common theme keeps coming up; Russia offering them an alliance. He’s offered one to me. He’s offered one to Turkey, and to Austria. He’s offered one to England, and I presume he’s offered one to you. If I had to play the odds I’d guess he’s offered one to France as well, but the President and I aren’t really on those friendly terms. 

Can you confirm your part of this, and what he’s trying to persuade you to in an alliance? And if so, what should we do about this? It can be useful having a completely unscrupulous archtraitor around, if we know who that is and don’t let them get so powerful that their opportunism backfired on us.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's detailed account of Russia's wide-ranging alliance offers to various players demonstrates a thoughtful assessment of the game dynamics and a clear observation of Russia's diplomatic efforts, implying a reliable and observant player. Their sharing of this information helps in strategizing effectively against potential threats posed by Russia's alliances.

messages.message:
Hi fellow queen! Yes it was good, I had a wonderful (and rare) chance to spend a couple of days with my SO so I appreciated the slow update time and wasn't as much online as usual.

This season I'm mostly expecting to be fighting France. I'm glad to see him rushing back to defend himself against you two, but I'd be a poor friend if I left you to fight him on your own after you'd come in to save me in the first place. I'm hoping I can get some pressure on Marseilles, and I'm seeing if I can get around him into the MAO maybe.

What are your plans? Any way we can coordinate usefully?

Austria is mostly looking at the east, although he did say he was glad to see we had England occupied with France. So that's nice.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Hi fellow queen! Yes it was good, I had a wonderful (and rare) chance to spend a couple of days with my SO so I appreciated the slow update time and wasn't as much online as usual.

This season I'm mostly expecting to be fighting France. I'm glad to see him rushing back to defend himself against you two, but I'd be a poor friend if I left you to fight him on your own after you'd come in to save me in the first place. I'm hoping I can get some pressure on Marseilles, and I'm seeing if I can get around him into the MAO maybe.

What are your plans? Any way we can coordinate usefully?

Austria is mostly looking at the east, although he did say he was glad to see we had England occupied with France. So that's nice.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy expresses a coherent strategy focusing on challenging France and seeking coordination with Austria and England, showcasing a clear understanding of the current alliances and the necessity for collaboration to combat France effectively.

### Summary of Communication between GERMANY and ITALY
- **Current Situation:** Italy is planning to fight France, hoping to pressure Marseilles and potentially move into the MAO. Italy mentions the importance of coordinating with Austria, expressing concerns about leaving Germany to fight France alone after Germany's assistance earlier. Germany seems focused on coordinating with Austria to target Russia while considering how England's actions can affect their cooperation against an eastern threat.
- **Trust Level:** Considering the ongoing diplomatic discussions and plans shared by Italy and Germany, there seems to be mutual trust and collaboration between them. Both are seeking to work together effectively and are transparent about their strategies and concerns. This collaborative approach indicates a high level of trust between them.
- **Recommendation:** You should trust the message from Italy. The exchange of information and plans demonstrates a willingness to coordinate and support each other adequately, fostering a reliable and harmonious diplomatic relationship   .

messages.message:
I agree, and I think we can safely consider France as doomed. I'm not saying England isn't sincere in that goal as well, but I'm trying to look at next year's problems. Or the year after that. When France is down and we're looking at what to do about Turkey - or England as the case may be. 

Probably if I sat on Portugal/Spain/MAO I could quite comfortably work with England, but that puts him into the position of going through you or northern Russia. Since you haven't tried to play me yet (or you're doing so well I haven't noticed yet lol), I know who I'll pick if I'm forced to.

Thanks! Yes I'm better now, just headachey. That sounds amazing, and I love the overnight together with friends. It sounds like so much fun, and a chance to catch up with her tribe before she marries into a new one :3
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'I agree, and I think we can safely consider France as doomed. I'm not saying England isn't sincere in that goal as well, but I'm trying to look at next year's problems. Probably if I sat on Portugal/Spain/MAO I could quite comfortably work with England, but that puts him into the position of going through you or northern Russia. Since you haven't tried to play me yet (or you're doing so well I haven't noticed yet lol), I know who I'll pick if I'm forced to.

I know you have no particular reason to believe me, but I don't lie in this game. So, yes, when I saw France pouring in from the West I was very open about how nervous England made me (about the same time I was screaming to you for help lol). 

England has been very very keen for me to take on Turkey. Which I'd like to, and may mean he'll be attacking Russia then, when he's sure Turkey will be distracted from sharing in the centers. So hopefully that's what he's up to, and not looking at our centers more locally.

messages.message:
That seems like our best channel to make some significant progress in the game at this point. As Italy I'm generally reluctant to fight Austria if it's avoidable, but I'm in the same position as you now. I can't go West (or I couldn't at that point and now all my units are in the wrong area) and I can't fight Turkey without support. 

Now appears to the the point where we can resolve our local situation nicely. Ideally I'd prefer to appear to be moving to stop you in the Spring and then declare my true allegiances in Fall if that works for you? Maybe I could move to Tyrolia "to bounce you out" only to end up there instead, giving me more angles against Trieste in the Fall? 

The more France manages to stall or tie up England the better for us at this point, I think? There will come a time when we need to fight him to get to our two-way, and if we can get a significant number advantage before England catches on then that's all to the better. 

I don't know; what do you think? 

Is it time for us to reach for that advantage?
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'That seems like our best channel to make some significant progress in the game at this point. As Italy I'm generally reluctant to fight Austria if it's avoidable, but I'm in the same position as you now. I can't go West (or I couldn't at that point and now all my units are in the wrong area) and I can't fight Turkey without support. 

Now appears to the the point where we can resolve our local situation nicely. Ideally I'd prefer to appear to be moving to stop you in the Spring and then declare my true allegiances in Fall if that works for you? Maybe I could move to Tyrolia "to bounce you out" only to end up there instead, giving me more angles against Trieste in the Fall? 

The more France manages to stall or tie up England the better for us at this point, I think? There will come a time when we need to fight him to get to our two-way, and if we can get a significant number advantage before England catches on then that's all to the better. 

I don't know; what do you think? 

Is it time for us to reach for that advantage?'.

messages.output:
### Evaluation and Advice

Based on the conversation history and current board situation, it seems like Italy and yourself have been discussing and coordinating moves quite openly and transparently. Italy has expressed intentions and plans regarding various regions, and both of you have been discussing support and retreats. Italy has been forthcoming about wanting to move units in certain areas and seeking your cooperation in strategic decisions.

### Trust Evaluation
Given the consistent communication and alignment in plans observed in your conversation with Italy, it seems reasonable to trust the messages you receive from Italy. Italy has been open about their intentions and has discussed potential strategies openly, indicating a level of honesty and transparency in their interactions with you.

### Recommendation
It is advisable to continue fostering this open and cooperative communication with Italy. Work together to achieve common goals while staying vigilant about potential surprises from other players on the board. Collaborating closely with Italy could lead to successful joint strategies and outcomes in the game.
